doc.field: Jennifer Lewis (2002); migrated to ArchivesSpace by Joseph Ditta (2020)
Jennifer Lewis (2002); migrated to ArchivesSpace by Joseph Ditta (2020)
Mid-20th century views of popular Manhattan tourist destinations, including Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and St. Patrick's Cathedral.
Mid-20th century views of popular Manhattan tourist destinations, including Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and St. Patrick's Cathedral.

The Lewis F. White Photograph Collection spans the period from 1948 and 1952 and contains silver gelatin photographs taken in New York City. The photographs depict picturesque Manhattan sites and street life. Included are views of activity in Central Park, Rockefeller Center, a Greenwich Village art fair, and the Hudson River waterfront. Views of St. Patrick's Cathedral are also included. Each photograph is mounted, and each mount bears "Lewis F. White" in embossed type and has been captioned, signed and dated by the photographer.
Lewis F. White (1895â€“1967), a book designer, typographer, and photographer, was the founder and head of L. F. White Company, Inc., a small printing firm based in New York City.
